SENT.plain: INTRODUCTION: Transient global amnesia is a classical disease
It presents with an abrupt onset of anterograde amnesia
It's incidence and recurrence rate is low
CASE PRESENTATION: In this case report a 54-year old white male is presented with two attacks of loss of memory within a year
CONCLUSION: Recurrent transient global amnesia is rare
Recognition and explaining the good nature of the symptoms to the patient and their families is an important task for the doctor
